page.title: 15Festivals - Lay
page.content: May Day, Spring and August Bank Holidays are public holidays when the majority of people do not work. On March 1st. in Wales schools celebrate St. David's Day with a half day's holiday and concert during which children sing, dance and recite in Welsh and English. The girls dress in Welsh costume - checked woollen skirt, betgwm shawl, blouse and a tall black hat. Most people wear a leek or daffodil. A 'duck' race is held to raise money for the Folk Festival. People pay for numbered plastic ducks which are raced down the River Tawe. The Folk Festival is held in August. People attend from different parts of the world for a weekend of folk music and dance. There is a parade of dancers and bands through the village of Pontardawe and also a craft market.
